definition[0]: to go onto someone’s private land without their permission
example[0]: She was arrested for trespassing on government property.
definition[2]: the offence of going onto someone’s land without their permission
example[1]: He will be prosecuted for trespass.
definition[3]: something you have done that is morally wrong
definition[4]: to go onto someone’s land or into their property without their permission
example[2]: Union organizers had trespassed on company premises to try and recruit new members.
